Abstract: This study explores the versatility of piezoelectric composites, focusing on their unique properties and applications. Piezoelectric composites, which combine the advantages of single crystals and ceramics, exhibit enhanced performance in terms of piezoelectric coefficients, mechanical strength, and thermal stability. The connectivity of the composite components plays a crucial role in determining the overall performance, particularly in ultrasound applications. Through a comprehensive review of recent advancements, this paper highlights the design strategies and fabrication techniques that optimize the piezoelectric response. The results demonstrate the potential of these composites in a wide range of applications, from medical imaging to non-destructive testing, underscoring their significance in the development of advanced piezoelectric devices.
